decks.notes: This Sultai Control deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's deck and hand while controlling the board with removal spells. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Thought Erasure, while building card advantage with Dig Through Time and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. The win condition is to either mill out the opponent with Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, or to stabilize the board with Inverter of Truth and secure victory. This deck excels at outlasting opponents and disrupting their strategies.

This deck focuses on generating white mana with Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to power out aggressive creatures and planeswalkers to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Knight of the White Orchid to establish board presence, while using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Gideon of the Trials to boost their power and protect them. Karn, the Great Creator also provides utility by fetching artifacts like Walking Ballista to control the board. Overall, the deck aims to win through fast, aggressive plays with powerful synergies between its cards.

The deck focuses on using Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by milling yourself out while having no cards left in your library. It includes cards like Thoughtseize, Thought Erasure, and Dig Through Time to control the opponent's hand and dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Eliminate to deal with threats on the board. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game through self-mill.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Thassa's Oracle and Dig Through Time, then use Inverter of Truth to swap the library with the graveyard, allowing for a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Eliminate to control the opponent's hand and board, while using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy for additional card advantage. The deck aims to set up a game-winning combo as efficiently as possible while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes low-cost creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Wild Slash and Lightning Strike, to apply early pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Eidolon of the Great Revel to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recur small creatures from the graveyard.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to utilize the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game quickly by either milling the opponent's library or creating a win condition with the Oracle's ability. The deck focuses on control elements such as hand disruption, removal spells, and card draw to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes versatile cards like Dig Through Time and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to help maintain card advantage and find key pieces of the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field alongside various ramp and card draw spells to quickly build up mana and dig through the deck to assemble a game-winning combo. With cards like Underworld Breach and Fae of Wishes, the deck aims to find key pieces like Thassa's Oracle to win the game in a single turn. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as the companion, providing additional value and resilience to the deck. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around generating enormous amounts of mana and finding the right pieces to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana quickly in order to power out powerful combo pieces like Thassa's Oracle and Underworld Breach. The deck also includes various support cards like Fae of Wishes, Hidden Strings, and Pore Over the Pages to manipulate the board state and dig for key pieces of the combo. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently, while protecting the key pieces from disruption, to win the game quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost aggressive creatures while also utilizing various support cards and planeswalkers to control the board and generate value. The deck focuses on building a wide board presence and maintaining pressure on the opponent through efficient creature plays and disruptive spells. With a mix of powerful creatures like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and support cards like Gideon of the Trials, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a high number of low-cost creatures and enchantments that provide consistency and support. The deck focuses on early aggression and board presence to control the game, using cards like Thraben Inspector and Knight of the White Orchid to apply pressure. With access to powerful white cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Gideon of the Trials, the deck aims to establish a dominant board state and quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and the ability to answer threats.

Utilizing Lotus Field and Underworld Breach alongside Fae of Wishes to dig through the deck, find combo pieces, and win through an alternate win condition with Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to ramp quickly with Arboreal Grazer and Satyr Wayfinder, while also utilizing cards like Strategic Planning and Pore Over the Pages to filter through the deck efficiently. Hidden Strings allows for additional untaps and plays, while Sylvan Scrying helps find Lotus Field. The deck is focused on assembling the combo pieces and winning quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field as a key piece in a combo strategy. By using cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field and generate mana, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Expansion/Explosion or Fae of Wishes to win the game. Additionally, cards like Underworld Breach and Pore Over the Pages help to dig through the deck and find the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently. The deck focuses on ramping up quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

This Control deck aims to utilize the powerful Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a card advantage engine. By running a diverse array of cards of different colors, it maximizes the chances of hitting multiple spells off of Niv-Mizzet's trigger. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells and disruptive cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the multiple colors required for Niv-Mizzet's ability, ensuring consistency in casting spells and maximizing the deck's potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. By utilizing the card advantage and selection offered by Teferi, Time Raveler and Niv-Mizzet Reborn, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while slowing down their game plan. The deck also includes versatile cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Bring to Light to provide additional utility and consistency. The mana base is designed to support the deck's flexible color requirements, allowing for a wide range of spells to be cast efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, disruption, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up its own resources. The deck also includes powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to help close out the game once control has been established. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to outvalue the opponent through careful resource management and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. It aims to outlast opponents by consistently answering threats and generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Dig Through Time, and Omen of the Sea. The mana base is built around Azorius dual lands and utility lands like Field of Ruin, providing both consistency and flexibility. Overall, the deck prioritizes stability and resource management to outmaneuver opponents and emerge victorious in longer games.
